_header: Christ that art light and day so bright
_description: James Ryman, another version of ‘Criste qui lux’ — seven quatrains (aabb) plus 4-line burden (cccd): ‘Criste qui lux es et dies / Noctis tenebras detegis / Lucisque lumen crederis / Lumen beatum predicans’

CULEe112.First Lines:
Criste that art light and day so brightderkenes of nyght turnyst to
                    light…
CULEe112.Last Lines:
…With the fader and holy goostBothe thre & one of myghtes
                    moost
